cause.description:
"The World Society for the Protection of Animals (WSPA) is the world’s largest network for animal welfare. It brings together over 1,000 Member Societies in more than 155 countries and a whole community of individuals around the world who care about animal welfare.
WSPA’s animal welfare programmes include a mix of direct fieldwork, campaigning, education and training, and member society development. With so many global issues and limited resources, WSPA has created a framework for the prioritisation of its work.
WSPA‘s work is focused on four priority animal welfare areas:
1. Companion animal - responsible pet ownership, humane stray management, and preventing cruelty.
2. Commercial exploitation of wildlife - intensive farming, and cruel management and killing of wild animals for food or products.
3. Disaster relief for animals - providing relief to animals in distress from man-made or natural disasters.
4. Farm animals - intensive farming, long distance transportation, and inhumane slaughter of domestic animals for food."
